coreCitation.title: Boston Rent
coreCitation.briefDescription: Estimated proportion of rent to income as a percent of total occupied units, aggregated to the census tract level; geography covers the City of Boston; time period covers 2014-2018 as a five year average
coreCitation.fullNotes: This dataset, which was acquired from data.census.gov, contains statistical information aggregated to the Census tract level and clipped to the extent of the city of Boston. It includes information about the estimated number of units in Boston per Census tract containing people paying rent, an estimate of occupied units with people paying a gross rent that is 30-34.5% of their total income, an estimate of occupied units with people paying a gross rent that is 30% or more of their total income and finally an estimate of people paying 35% or more of their total income. This data came from the American Community Survey rolling 5-year estimates, and covers a time period from 2014-2018.
coreCitation.briefGenealogy:
1. Census tract geometries were downloaded from a census data extract tool. 
 2. Statistical data about rent as a percent of total income per census tract were also downloaded from a census data extract tool. 
 3. Extracted statistical tables were cleaned up to included only fields pertinent to the subject of inquiry. 
 4. Fields were renamed to human-readable column headers, and documented in a new codebook. 
 5. Cleaned up statistical tables were joined together in a GIS software with the census geometry files to create the new Boston Rent GIS dataset.
coreCitation.accessCondition: This dataset is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

temporal.temporalNotes: This dataset is derived as rolling estimates from the 2014-2018 5-year American Community Survey

representation.healthCheckQualifier:
The Census Bureau's ACS Design & Methodology Report details the process by which survey questions were first developed and how stakeholders were initially included in that process.  
 
 The Census Bureau does not make documentation available on the topic of ongoing plans for inclusion of the voices of those represented by and most impacted by the survey.

publicResponsibility.healthCheckQualifier:
The Census Bureau's ACS Design and Methodology Report is healthy on issues related to technical methodology for geographic aggregation and anonymization. It also discusses how the Census Bureau understands the mandatory nature of the Census, and the reasons why the data is beneficial to society. 
 
 There is not healthy documentation available on any known privacy issues or methods taken to ensure all participants understand how their data will be used.

historicContext.healthCheckQualifier: The documentation does not reflect on the ways the data program is at risk for repeating past harms. It does not describe the ways in which U.S. census data collection has considered its relationship and contribution to systemic injustice.

methodology.healthCheckQualifier:
The Census Bureau's ACS Design and Methodology Report provides extremely healthy documentation about the technical methdologies used to produce the survey data. 
 
 The documentation could state more clearly how the data should and should not be used, with clearer remarks about known limitations.

potentialImpact.healthCheckQualifier:
There is healthy documentation about potential positive impact and future funding dependent on this data program. 
 
 There is not very much easily discoverable documentation about potential negative impact, especially if there are existing factors which should be flagged to avoid harm.

publishedWorks.title: Proportion of units where rent costs over 30% of resident's income
publishedWorks.author: Huffman, Daniel P.
publishedWorks.publisher: Boston Public Library. Norman B. Leventhal Map and Education Center

codebooks.title: Renamed Fields Dictionary
codebooks.notes: Cartographer Daniel Huffman provided a codebook for how they renamed fields when cleaning this dataset.

ingredients.notes: This census tract geography data was joined to census statistical demographic data
This statistical census demographic data was joined to census tract geography data
